ygData.subject: Re: Greetings...
ygData.msgSnippet: Hey! ... Wow! A MUCKer.  Every once in a while I run into someone online and I can just tell they MUCKd/MUSHd/MUDd. It s always nice to meet someone else who
ygData.messageBody:
Hey!

> From: wraven@...
> FurryMUCK (that was a long time ago it seems looking back:) EQ
> seems pretty tame on the adult side, if you don't count language

Wow! A MUCKer. Every once in a while I run into someone online and I can just tell they MUCKd/MUSHd/MUDd. It's always nice to meet someone else who did that. I know Furry MUCK of course, though I didn't play it myself. I was a hard core MUSHer though on a MUSH called telamagica based on the 'Ars Magica' role playing game (the best RPG ever created IMHO).

> (50/50) when some wanker shouts "man those human/DE/High Elf/Blah blah babes are hot!" ;) And actually that brings up another rant, I seem

*Sigh* what can you do? Give /feedback I guess! I'll remember to rant next time I'm on.

One thing I'm sure everyone would like to see is more options in designing your character portrait. Maybe EQ won't get them, but maybe the next game will. I want a little slider bar I can use to control the size of my breasts personally.

> little more than hack and slash. I loved Ultima Online for the world, but left it because of all the horrible "Kewl d00ds" that made the
> place seem like some kind of kindergarten class overrun
> by demonically power misbehaved children.

Lol! That about sums it up.

> I would love that, I think we should form our own multi-server guild:)
> I am playing (and I should really focus on one character one of

I've considered that. I figure I'll wait and see how this mailing list goes, and if there is enough interest, form a guild. Some ideas I have for forming a guild would include:
- have it on one server, not multiple servers, to
ensure there would be enough guild members
availble to form a cohesive guild.
- have it on a new server (I'm sure Verant will
keep adding servers for a while). This is fair
to everyone (everyone needs to start a fresh
character). It also allows the opportunity to
get involved in a brand new environment.
I figure I'll check back with the list in a couple of months and see how people feel about this.

> make money off it:) First and foremost though I
> am a Writer, its what I love to do. Although recently I havnt written
> too much, mabye I'm playing too much EQ...;)

I'm a writer as well, but it is very hard (when you're as completely addicted to EQ as I am) to find the time to write. My approach is the 'burnout' approach, I'm trying to play this game until I completely burn out my interest in it. Hope it works, or I'll just be a very addicted 60 year old some day.

Chat with you soon,

Christina
